definition: to affect adversely/to delay or hinder/to waste (an opportunity)/to mislead

sentences.english: The driver should he responsible for this major accident, because he operated improperly and missed the braking time.
sentences.chinese: 该重大事故是由于司机操纵不当，贻误制动时机造成。

sentences.english: Bungle a step and it's, how do you say in English, swill .
sentences.chinese: 贻误了一步，它的，你怎么说英语，泔水。

sentences.english: The delayed player deleg stay on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 被贻误的运动员代表团停留在操场上。

sentences.english: He fumbled the one slender chance we had.
sentences.chinese: 他贻误了我们获得的一个微小的机会。

sentences.english: You must make up the work you missed.
sentences.chinese: 你得补上你贻误的事情。

sentences.english: This problem shall be solved at once, or the project process would be delated .
sentences.chinese: 这个问题必须马上解决，否则会贻误工期。

definition: to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup
to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)
variant of 耽誤|耽误[dan1 wu5]
to let sth slip by/to miss an opportunity
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
to listen to information/to get the news/to believe what one hears
to falsely believe/to be mislead/to fall for (a trick etc)
to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
